title: President Trump Says Hamas Must Give Up Weapons for Peace in Gaza
summary: President Trump talked about two big things. First, he said that for peace in Gaza, a group called Hamas must give up their weapons. Gaza is a place where there has been fighting. Trump wants a peace deal to help people there. Second, the U.S. military attacked boats in Venezuela that were carrying drugs. This is part of a plan to stop drug trafficking. Trump also mentioned that Russia's leader told him Ukraine tried to attack a home, and Trump believed this. The article shows Trump is working on different problems around the world, like peace in Gaza and stopping drugs.

questions.question: Why did the U.S. attack boats in Venezuela?

background_read: Gaza is a small area with many people who have faced fighting for years. Hamas is a group that controls Gaza and has been in conflicts with Israel. Peace deals are agreements to end fighting and help people live safely. Venezuela is a country in South America where there are problems with drugs. The U.S. sometimes takes action in other countries to address issues like drug trafficking or support peace efforts.
Article_Structure: WHO: President Trump and other leaders like Russia's President Putin
WHAT: Trump said Hamas must disarm for peace in Gaza, and the U.S. attacked drug boats in Venezuela
WHY: To promote peace in Gaza and combat drug trafficking in Venezuela

perspectives.description: Believes peace in Gaza requires Hamas to give up weapons, and supports military action in Venezuela to stop drugs
